page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: {Mixed farms}grow barley/wheat and have a variety of livestock.There are 500 to 800 sheep comprising of Suffolk, white faced Mules, Texals, and Border Leicesters.Lambing usually takes place under cover between January and May. Ewes lambing early are sheared.Ewes average 1.5 lambs per head and lambs when sold average about 126p/kg for a 14.5kg animal.Fattening cattle comprise of Freisian/Hereford and continental breeds such as Charolais, Simmental and Limousins.The cattle are sold direct to the abbatoir or sent to the local market (Market Bosworth), selling prices 95.8p/kg for steers and 92.5p/kg for heifers.There are a few pigs reared market prices about 80.6p/kg.A mixed farm at Sheepy Magna also has laying hens.The eggs are sold direct to local shops and at the farm gates.
